Class User

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cmput301f20t14.bookbox.entities.User
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class User
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    An entity class that encapsulates the user of the app.
    Version:
    2020.11.04
    Author:
    Olivier Vadiavaloo, Alex Mazzuca
    See Also:

      • User

        public User(java.lang.String username,
            java.lang.String password,
            java.lang.String phone,
            java.lang.String email,
            java.util.ArrayList<Book> ownedBooks,
            java.util.ArrayList<Book> borrowedBooks,
            java.lang.String photoUrl)
        Constructor of the User class
        Parameters:
        username - username of the user's BookBox account
        password - password of the user's BookBox account
        phone - user's phone number
        email - email associated with the user's BookBox account
        ownedBooks - ArrayList of books owned by user
        borrowedBooks - ArrayList of books borrowed by user

    • Method Detail

      • updateContactInfo

        public void updateContactInfo(java.lang.String username,
                              java.lang.String password,
                              java.lang.String phone)
        This method is called when there is a need to update the username, password and phone number of the user. It is then unnecessary to call the setters individually.
        Parameters:
        username - username for the user's BookBox account
        password - password for the user's BookBox account
        phone - the phone number of the user

      • updateContactInfo

        public void updateContactInfo(java.lang.String username,
                              java.lang.String password,
                              java.lang.String email,
                              java.lang.String phone)
        This overloaded method is called when there is a need to update the username, password, phone number AND the email of the user. It is then unnecessary to call the setters individually.
        Parameters:
        username - username for the user's BookBox account
        password - password for the user's BookBox account
        phone - the phone number of the user
